title: How to Make Zucchini Banana Bread

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).
steps.description: Lightly grease pans with a bit of butter.

steps.headline: Mix softened butter and sugar together in the large bowl.
Stir in two eggs and cut up bananas.
steps.description: Mix until nearly smooth. Lumpiness is to be expected.

steps.headline: Shred about 1 cup of zucchini.
steps.description: Stir into the mixture. The zucchini shreds should not be too long, so shred in very short strokes.

steps.headline: Stir in the buttermilk and vanilla.
Gently mix in the flour, baking soda, and salt.
steps.description: Mix until you have an even consistency.

steps.headline: Pour batter into pans until it reaches halfway up each pan.
Bake each pan for approximately 45-50 minutes.
steps.description: Bake until the tops are golden and a toothpick inserted into the bread comes out clean. Let cool for 10 minutes and then serve!

text: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C). Lightly grease pans with a bit of butter. Mix softened butter and sugar together in the large bowl. Mix thoroughly. Stir in two eggs and cut up bananas. Mix until nearly smooth. Lumpiness is to be expected. Shred about 1 cup of zucchini. Stir into the mixture. The zucchini shreds should not be too long, so shred in very short strokes. Stir in the buttermilk and vanilla.  Gently mix in the flour, baking soda, and salt. Mix until you have an even consistency. Pour batter into pans until it reaches halfway up each pan.  Bake each pan for approximately 45-50 minutes. Bake until the tops are golden and a toothpick inserted into the bread comes out clean. Let cool for 10 minutes and then serve!
